185298165.review:
Olá! Acabei de finalizar o jogo e estou aqui para compartilhar a minha experiência.

Ainda não joguei os outros dois jogos anteriores da franquia, então talvez eu não tenha tanto poder de fala. Entretanto, apesar das diversas críticas negativas que vejo serem proferidas a esse jogo, eu sinceramente discordo de grande parte delas. Para detalhar especificadamente minha opinião, irei usar tópicos.

- Mapa/Mundos: Para mim, o jogo falha bastante nesse quesito. São tantas áreas que poderiam ser exploradas melhores que foram reduzidas a um espaço pequeno ou dividido em várias salas, podendo ser somente um grande espaço que remeta ao local escolhido para a adaptação. Digo isso especificadamente para áreas como a sala da justiça, a batcaverna e, principalmente, os planetas. Apesar da exploração planetária nesse jogo ser bem única, acho que deixa a desejar no quesito de riqueza ao redor desses mundos. Dito tudo isso, por mais que eu não tenha gostado muito dessa parte, acho que foi feito de uma boa maneira.

- Personagens: Eu ainda não joguei o LEGO DC Supervillains, então não sei exatamente qual dos dois jogos possui o melhor catálogo de personagens, porém, somente nesse, heróis de várias histórias diferentes no universo da DC Comics foram adaptados para serem personagens jogáveis. Por mais que falte um pouco na parte dos vilões, a área dos heróis não deixa a desejar. Pessoalmente, eu passei grande parte do jogo jogando com a Zatanna! :)

Existem outros tópicos para citar, como os aspectos padrões de todos os jogos LEGO, mas imagino que não haja necessidade, visto que a minha opinião é definitivamente positiva.

184897125.review:
Una de las peores campañas de todos los juegos Lego que he probado en mi vida, historia aburrida, niveles repetitivos, poco interesantes y por lo menos fastidiosos a la hora de re-jugarlos, bugs molestos, y sobre todo la sobre necesidad de usar los mismos 3 únicos personajes para obtener el 100% forzosamente en todos los niveles (Poison Ivy, Plastic-Man y Brainiac) este último siendo un personaje con cero personalidad, carisma, o sinceramente motivación, siendo el antagonista principal de más de la mitad del juego en dónde se resume "no puedes atraparme, oh! me atrapaste, pero nuevamente no puedes atraparme muajaja" durante 7 niveles de los 15 que tiene el juego.

La historia es tan mala, que a comparación de los anteriores Lego Batman deja muy mal parado la tercera entrega de la franquicia. Siendo la primer entrega mi favorita, la segunda no tanto por la implementación de la Justice League de manera abrupta, pero reconfortante en cuanto a mapa, diseño, niveles y tener la disposición de estar en toda Gotham City a nuestro antojo.

Aquí parece que hicieron un popurrí de mundos abiertos y secciones de la Baticueva, la Atalaya, y el Salón de la Justicia; del resto son secciones extra que son más un menú para acceder a planetas distintos (bastante diferentes, coloridos y divertidos, pero en cuanto a misiones casi todos se parecen en las mismas y aburridas tareas que se repiten 6 veces o hasta más dentro de un mismo planeta).

El roster de personajes es el mejor hasta la fecha *(reseñando sin antes haber probado LEGO Super Villains)* tiene la mayor cantidad de personajes, vehículos, variantes, agregados de series, películas y medios diferentes, haciendo un gran favor al juego, tiene una muy buena adición como lo son los personajes: Man of Steel, The Dark Knight, Green Arrow, Batman del Futuro, y la Serie Televisiva de Batman del 66´ entre muchos otros; todos son divertidos de usar, así como la personalidad, diálogos, y habilidades que estos pueden tener.

Sin embargo esto se va mermando, porqué no son tan útiles como algunos otros que tienen varias habilidades que te pueden ayudar a sobrepasar los niveles de una manera eficaz, sin mucho esfuerzo y sin complicaciones para desbloquearlos, a excepción de los primeros tres que mencione anteriormente.

LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham ofrece una de las mejores experiencias en conocer el mundo de DC Comics adaptado a los video juegos, llevándolo al universo cómico y carácteristico a las historias que tiene Traveller's Tales para contarnos. Sencillamente la historia es aburrida, el ambiente es malo, y aún así me divertí al acabar el juego al 100% por ser un juego de Batman, un mal juego, pero que se esfuerza en ofrecer mucho pero que se quedó corto en el núcleo del juego: Jugabilidad e Historia

184717054.review:
Batman Lego 3: Beyond Gotham is a love letter to DC Comics fans, wrapped in brick-shaped goodness. As a proud DC aficionado, I felt like I’d stumbled into the ultimate fan cave. This game isn’t just about the Bat; it’s a sprawling celebration of the DC Universe with a roster so massive it feels like the Crisis on Infinite Minifigures. Whether you’re zipping through the galaxy as Green Lantern, smashing things as Solomon Grundy, or marveling at the inclusion of obscure characters like Bat-Mite, the game keeps you geeking out with every unlocked hero (or villain). Plus, who wouldn’t want to see Batman in a spacesuit cracking jokes while saving the universe? It's classic DC with a quirky Lego twist.

The game shines in its sheer variety. Each level feels like a comic issue brought to life, with nods to iconic DC moments, hilarious inside jokes, and puzzles that make you think while still feeling accessible. The humor is spot-on for fans, whether it’s poking fun at Aquaman’s reputation or having Adam West himself as a playable character (yes, the Bright Knight is here!). And the environments? Gorgeous! From the Lantern Corps’ homeworlds to the depths of the Batcave, every corner is brimming with Easter eggs. If you’re a DC fan, skipping this game would be as unforgivable as mixing Kryptonite into Superman's morning smoothie.

184677885.review:
Lego Batman 3 é um ótimo jogo, mas com certeza um regresso em comparação ao seu antecessor Lego Batman 2, principalmente quando se fala de inovação e mundo aberto, esse jogo deixa a desejar.

Esse lego parece desfocar no personagem Batman e focar 100% na Liga da Justiça, então deveria se chamar Lego Liga da Justiça. E eu não acho isso ruim, somente acho que deveriam focar na real proposta do jogo. Outros jogos conseguem fazer até 4 ou 5 sequências sem perder o foco, então é algo que eu realmente esperava desse jogo.

Apesar das críticas (Todos os jogos têm, é normal) é um jogo extremamente divertido, e consegue cumprir o objetivo de ser um bom Lego, com seu humor único e sem altos problemas (O que eu citei acima é algo que normalmente é ofuscado pela diversão que esse jogo proporciona).

184473228.review:
LEGO® Batman™ 3: Beyond Gotham – A Galactic LEGO Adventure

LEGO® Batman™ 3: Beyond Gotham takes the LEGO Batman series to new heights, quite literally, by expanding the action beyond Gotham City and into space. In this installment, Batman teams up with the Justice League to stop Brainiac from shrinking and collecting planets, threatening the entire universe. The game successfully combines the quirky charm of LEGO with the vastness of the DC universe, offering players an expansive adventure with a host of beloved characters.

The story is entertaining, packed with humor and references to both the DC comics and movies. The introduction of voice acting gives the characters more personality, and the banter between Batman, Superman, and other heroes is full of comedic moments. The plot is engaging but doesn't stray far from the typical superhero formula, making it enjoyable yet predictable.

Gameplay is varied and fun, with a mix of action, puzzle-solving, and exploration. Players can take control of over 150 characters, each with unique abilities, from Batman’s gadgets to Green Lantern’s ring powers. The ability to switch between heroes is great for solving puzzles and exploring the different levels, which range from Earth to outer space. The game introduces a large variety of environments and settings, offering something fresh for fans of the series. However, some of the puzzles and level designs can feel repetitive, and the combat system remains simple, which might not provide enough challenge for more experienced players.

The visuals are vibrant and colorful, capturing the iconic LEGO style. The space environments and alien worlds are beautifully designed, but at times the camera can be a bit awkward, making it difficult to navigate tight spaces or action sequences. Co-op play is enjoyable, though the split-screen layout may be cumbersome for some players.

Overall, LEGO® Batman™ 3: Beyond Gotham successfully builds upon the previous games by offering a bigger, more expansive experience. While it may lack the challenge and innovation of other entries, its humor, diverse characters, and enjoyable gameplay make it a fun ride for all ages.

Score: 80/100

184076334.review:
Pros:
+ Super Suits are still cool, with Joker, Lex Luthor, and Cyborg getting their own super suits
+ Epic Soundtrack
+ Huge Character Roster
+ DLC Levels are great
+ Fantastic Story
+ Nice Easter Eggs, with two Superhero theme songs playing when flying around as Superman or Wonder Woman
+ The late Adam West makes an appearance in this game

Cons:
- Collecting various items and finding Adam Wests in peril get repetitive quickly
- Quests rely way too much on trial and error and some can be hard to complete
- Some Hub Races are frustrating
- The Batman of the Future Character Pack was not part of the Season Pass
- Perhaps this can get a remaster by Double Eleven?

183616997.review:
LEGO Batman 3 is a top tier LEGO Game. It's fun, quirky, quick-witted and lego! I used to play the living hell out of this game back in the day. Used to be my 2nd favourite to LEGO Batman 2 (int the batman trilogy). I now know why as it followed the same style as LEGO Marvel Superheros 1 which is a certified classic. I think this game doesn't meet that game but it does a better job with its roster of characters and side quests than LEGO Batman 2. 

For Casuals: This is just like any other LEGO Game in that it is fun, zero stress, good times. Fun with your kids, fun with your partner, fun with yourself (????). I poured countless hours into this game as a kid and had a blast. If you liked LEGO Marvel Superheros 1 then you'll adore this game. Overall 9/10. Some minor bugs and tricky puzzle spots that just wouldn't click in my brain, but nevertheless this is a well-made game. 

For 100%ers: It took me 29hrs to beat the game though I did have the game idle from time to time most likely 3/29hrs. It was so much fun to revisit this game but it's not as fun as the first game in the 100%ing department as there is just a lot to do. Over 140 characters, 250 gold bricks, 150 minikits, 50 In Perils and the usual 16 red bricks. There is 16 levels that have multiple chapters in most + DLC if you get that. It was a grind that I wasn't expecting, especially since I 100%'ed LEGO Marvel Superheros 1 in less time. But I enjoyed it...more than LEGO Hobbit for sure. Overall I'd give it a 7/10 mainly b/c of whats listed above and that the simpleness of the first LEGO Batman was missing as I found that I only really needed 6 out of the 147 characters which all had the same abilities as the 6 main ones. 

Final Score
Casuals: 9/10
100%er's: 7/10
Average: 8/10

183560145.review: "Lego Batman". But i'we been playing more with cyborg the whole time 10/10
